CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, August 6, 1960, pg. 1, reads: "'Sparked Riot' - Police - Ray Carrington, with his head bandaged, was identified by Wilkinsburg Patrolman John Hartman (right) as being the person who contributed greatly towards sparking the riot which halted a Bill Powell dance last Friday at the Royal Ballroom in Wilkinsburg. Fined $100 for disorderly conduct, Carrington also has been held for court on other charges and is under $1,500 bond - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Ray Carrington with bandage on head, and Wilkinsburg police officer John Hartman on right, raising hands in oath, possibly in magistrate's court, Wilkinsburg
